Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate a device (string telephone) that allows communication over a given distance.
The student can show how the device uses sound to communicate by including elements like cups and a string in the drawing.
The student can represent how the device sends or receives information by clearly connecting two students with the string telephone.
The student can label or depict any features of the design that solve the problem of distance communication, such as the length of the string or the positioning of the cups.
The student can explain through the drawing or brief notes why this device helps people communicate over long distances.
